summary: The 'Reducing Barriers for Broadband on Federal Lands Act of 2025' aims to expedite broadband infrastructure deployment on federal lands. It exempts certain broadband projects within rights-of-way from environmental and historical preservation reviews under the National Environmental Policy Act of 1969 and the National Historic Preservation Act. The bill defines key terms like 'broadband project,' 'broadband provider,' 'Federal authorization,' and 'right-of-way,' clarifying its scope and intended impact on broadband expansion.
